name: places/ChIJDUW-a1VYwokR6L1u9X92HSM
formattedAddress: 123 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 123 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036-4089, USA

editorialSummary.text: Extended-stay hotel offering upscale suites with kitchens & rooftop lounge with Times Square views.

originalText.text:
We had a great time staying at AKA Times Square.  Staff were awesome, very friendly, courteous and caring.   We stayed in the City Suite.  Very roomy especially for Manhattan.  Location is unbeatable.  The only little thing is that the windows are small.
Overall, we really like the hotel.  I think the friendly staff made the experience great.

text.text:

originalText.text:
Steps away from Time Square, many metro rail stations around the property.

Excellent location

The property doesn't accept Cash / currency notes payment, makes it very difficult if your credit card is set up on usage / transaction limits. The front desk team was extremely slow and took inordinate amounts of time, however they were kind enough to issue room at 11 am itself. The check out was super quick.

Rooms:
Very spacious & well appointed, but tired & oldish interiors, very soft bed. Many small issues with hinges, hand held shower etc...

Complimentary Tea Coffee & pastries
Every morning 7am to 11 am, on the Terrace level, a good touch,  however, the lady managing the counter was very slow to refill empty pots, in addition to slow response she dispayed very arrogant behavior.

originalText.text:
Our stay at the AKA New York was amazing. The room was fantastic with a washing machine and dryer and oven. The staff were always so friendly and kind. Kevin at the front desk was exceptional, our other Australian friends recommended the hotel because of Kevin and it was worth it!
We will be back!
Thank you from Australia

text.text:
Our stay at the AKA New York was amazing. The room was fantastic with a washing machine and dryer and oven. The staff were always so friendly and kind. Kevin at the front desk was exceptional, our other Australian friends recommended the hotel because of Kevin and it was worth it!
We will be back!
Thank you from Australia

originalText.text:
As far as apartment style long term stay hotels are concerned, AKA Times Square is the model that all others should aspire to.  First, the staff is just excellent.  From the moment I arrived, I felt welcome. I had so many bags because I am in between apartments and the staff could not have been more friendly and helpful just as if I only had one bag instead of 15 bags.

The room itself (premium studio) is fabulous.  There is a separate den containing a day bed and a closet and a door that closes so you can easily accommodate guests (note: that den needs its own television to make it perfect). The room also has a full kitchen with all the necessary ecoutrements and AND wait for it… a washer and dryer.  It really is fabulous.

The location is as the name suggests, right in the heart of Times Square with all the positives and negatives that go with such an iconic location.  During the holiday season it is super busy and crowded.  Be prepared.

The continental breakfast in the morning leaves a lot to be desired but that is really my only complaint.

If you need to be in New York for more than 5 days I would highly recommend the AKA Times Square.  You won’t regret it.

originalText.text:
We were here 8 nights in October. The position is wonderful and the service in general except the breakfast.

You wake up in the morning, go to P2 to find some pastry, and the lady that should give you the pastry doesn’t do her work. For two or 3 days we took only the coffee because there were anything to eat…

I put 1 star for this reason. When you pay so much money everything there must be a good service…
